Reviews.Title: “Great staff and easy location to access”
Reviews.Author: MelonieLorraine
Reviews.Content: We flew into Philly and arrived late with young children. It was nearly midnight but the front desk staff gave us a room on the first floor just down the hall from the front desk and the breakfast area. Very friendly and clean rooms. It's less than a 5 min drive from the rental car area at the airport...perfect! A new Wawa was going in around the corner from the hotel, so that will be a big plus. We liked this hotel so much that when we got stuck in a dive hotel in Washington DC, we drove back to Philly the night before our return flight and spent our last night at this Microtel!

Reviews.Title: “Felt unsafe!”
Reviews.Author: CCMEDIC
Reviews.Content: Felt unsafe after window left wide open by room service. We stayed on the first floor for three nights and did our own service. We also had the Do Not Disturb sign out. On the second night, we came back after exploring the city to find our curtains and window unlocked and wide open by room service. This would not have been so bad if we would not have been on the first floor! We complained to the front desk who did not care, only telling us that if anything was missing they were not responsible! There are no safes in the room and one of our bags was found unzipped. We did will never stay here again! Anyone could have reached in and stolen our belongings off of the window seat! Definite safety issues!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but still below average.”
Reviews.Author: Shaekin
Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel, worked for what we needed, but it wasn't particularly clean or well kept. The bathroom in particular. The bathtub was dirty as was the bathroom sink. The sink also ran extremely slow. The staff was extremely nice whenever we spoke to them however. I also woke up to what sounded like a herd of hippos dancing and falling off the bed in the room above us at 1:15 in the morning. A quick call to the front desk and the noises quieted significantly though. If you're looking for a cheap hotel you could do a lot worse, but I have a hard time rating this hotel as "average" or above, hence the 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: hellzapopper
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Philadelphia and I booked the Microtel because it was the least expensive. I've stayed in hotels for this price even less, but the condition of this one was the least desirable. It was ok for one night, but anymore I would've gone to the Marriott or the other surrounding hotels. Once you enter the hallway where the rooms are, it reeks terribly of pot. The room itself smelled like stale cigarettes. Burn marks everywhere. I would come here again just for an over night stay just because of it's convenience. If you're looking for a great atmosphere or ambiance this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “MISREPERSENTED”
Reviews.Author: dale s
Reviews.Content: dishonest and misrepersented about parking my confirmation says free private parking on site reservation is not needed i had to pay 6.95 per day

Reviews.Title: “It is "Micro"”
Reviews.Author: bltroy
Reviews.Content: Chose the Microtel based on price, proximity to the airport and travelers reviews. We booked two rooms for three people. We wished we had been warned how appropriate the name "Micro" fit this hotel. Our room was barely large enough to walk around the full-size bed. Really not that comfortable for two people. The bathroom toilet seat kept falling down in both rooms, so there is a flaw in the design. Our sheets seemed way to small and kept coming up at the corners of the bed, they also had a cigarette burn in them, The top cover on the bed had ink marks and the light in the bathroom was burned out. We had to keep the heat light going to see in the bathroom. We were greeted by cigarette buts were at the elevator entrance on the floor. The hotel was quiet, breakfast- basic but adequate, staff very pleasant, they apologized for the problems but said the reasons for the problems were the guests that stayed there. The hotel is trying - but we would not re-book...Especially when in actuality, they charge $20 more for a room that is not pre-paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: stevann0817
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the microtel at the phila airport Sunday, 01/08. although the room was very small, it was perfect for a quick overnight stay before departing for Mexico the next day. All employees were very pleasant and helpful. It is also clean and well maintained. The drivers for the airport shuttles were professional and friendly. We will def. stay here again when flying out of Phila.

Reviews.Title: “great for early morning flights with long vacations”
Reviews.Author: harleysvillesue
Reviews.Content: we were headed out of town for 2 weeks, with a very early flight and I didn't want to spend a fortune on airport parking. found park sleep fly website. They package a hotel rooms with 1 and 2 weeks of parking for pretty reasonable rate. Microtels 2 weeks of pkg and a room for 1night was $119. You can book it thru hotel directly but it is $10 more. Lot is not gated but with our old car we weren't overly concerned. Rooms are very basic but we were only there a total of 8 hours so it did not matter. Only negative was our wake up call never came, we had also set the alarm clock, but it must have been set to something on low, as you could barely hear it, so you might want to have your own alarm. Shuttle runs every half hour to airport, about a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay if traveling!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several times for flying out of Philly airport. It was clean, quiet, convenient. You can park/store your car for free while you are on vacation, they give you a wake up call, free breakfast and a shuttle to the airport for your flight. This year we decided to 'splurge' and stay at the airport Marriot. NEVER AGAIN. We shoulda stayed at the Microtel! you have to PAY to park at the marriot, 20$$ A DAY, even for the night you stay there you have to pay, no breakfast, and very expensive restaurant. We're gonna come back here next time, we were very happy with it. It was everything we expected and everything we were looking for: Clean, convenient, friendly, reasonable pricing, free parking...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for layover”
Reviews.Author: Arringfray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a layover on our way to Mexico. We called the hotel for a shuttle pick-up and it was there within 15 minutes. The driver was very friendly and it was a short 8 min ride to the hotel. Check in as very quick and easy and the desk clerk was very friendly as well. We went up to the room which was quite small but then we were only interested in getting a good nights sleep. The bed was quite comfortable and the room was clean. We had an early flight so we needed to catch the shuttle back to the airport at 4am. The shuttle leaves every 30 min so we headed down at 3:45am and told the desk we needed to catch the 4am shuttle. We were then told that the contental breakfast was open so we headed in there to grab a quick bite. There wasn't tons of options but enough for a nice snack. Right at 4am the driver came and told us the shuttle was ready and we were taken to airport. All in all our experience was great! If you're in the need of a safe and clean place to rest your head during a layover you would be hard pressed to top this place for the price. Would I plan to use the hotel for a vacation? No. The hotel is quite dated and I don't think I would want to spend more then one day there.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: cartaynic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in the month of December. We had two different early flights out of the Philly airport and opted to stay here each time the night before our flight so we could get an extra hour of sleep in the morning. The hotel is clean and convienent. There is a Wawa on the corner for snacks and the hotel offers a complementary continental breakfast. They offer free shuttle service to and from the airport. You can leave your car at the hotel while you are away for a fee of 7 dollars a day. It was the cheapest hotel I could find on the web so I was satisfied.....although it is certainly no Hilton or Sheraton but the price was 75% less than them...............

Reviews.Title: “Economy hotel, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: KeninAustin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was okay for the money; definitely a low cost alternative, but clean & safe. Breakfast was very limited and not worth eating. My issue was the free shuttle to the airport. When I called from the airport, I was told it would be 7 minutes to be picked up. I called back 25 minutes later, and was told that they were on the way, and we had just hung up (despite me waiting for and getting my checked bag, and having a 13 minute call with my wife. I was told 5 minutes. I called again after another 15 minutes and talked to the front desk. I am pretty sure they said two minutes; it was hard to tell because of the accent. I was picked up 15 minutes later. The ride was under 5 minutes to the hotel. The hotel was okay for the money. I will not go back because I hate being lied to.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good for the price”
Reviews.Author: digbyl
Reviews.Content: In need of a refit but did what was needed. Ruby Tuesdays to eat at close by. If you've hired a car it's easy to get into the city. The hotel breakfast though simple is useful & is included in the price. We didn't use the train though the station is only a short walk with trains every 30 minutes into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel to the airport, large rooms, lackluster service”
Reviews.Author: brusselsdaniel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times when traveling for work, most recently in March 2011. The property is much like the other handful of Micortels I have stayed in. Not fancy, but the beds are comfy and the rooms are large. One "cheap hotel" quirk I really don't enjoy are the high-mounted tv's which require you to look up to watch them, but I knew about this going in. The hotel itself is fine. I have no major complaints and there is a free airport shuttle. However, I find that the staff tend to be unfriendly or sometimes downright rude to customers. I experienced an uncomfortable moment of having a front desk staff member screaming into the phone at a client who was on her way to the property. It was very rude and certainly didn't make me feel good about being the next person to ask a question. Although it's possible to get good rates here, and to leave your car if you are flying from the airport, I will probably avoid this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: Buzzhombre
Reviews.Content: I had a flight from the West Coast arriving at Philadelphia in late evening, so I went looking for something nearby. This turned out to be about the most affordable hotel in the airport area with a shuttle van. As a bonus, it's right next to the Eastwick commuter rail station, and I needed to get to 30th Street Station in the morning. So this seemed like a good choice. Once I picked up my checked bag, I called the hotel, and they said they'd send the van. It turned out, my flight crew was waiting at the same location, and their van to the Hilton showed up only a couple of minutes before the Microtel's van. The staff at the desk was not the most efficient I've ever seen. One guy spent the whole time on the computer, while the other was checking people in--and he wasn't particularly fast. They gave me one of the handicapped rooms, which did not have a "no smoking" sign, and there was an ashtray in the room, but it did not smell of cigarette smoke. The room was fine for a fairly short night. After all, this is a Microtel, not a Hilton. The breakfast was OK. In the morning I walked to one block to Eastwick and caught a train downtown. If you're flying into Philadelphia late, or flying out early, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: reserved44
Reviews.Content: Would not reccommend it. Shabby. Bed was quite comfortable.Staff friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but dirtiest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKatie11
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to its proximity to the Philadelphia Airport. Having never stayed in the area before, I based my choice on the price and on some recommendations from another website. I was so disappointed! The location was great, but the room was filthy. The lighting was really dim at first (it eventually got brighter), but there was a huge stain on the window seat, and there were hairs all over (the corner of the bathroom, in the sink, etc.). I wish I would have paid a little more and stayed somewhere else - there are lots of other hotels on the same street, just as close to the airport. The only pros: staff were helpful, close to airport, price (but still not worth staying here), continental breakfast included (but not great), and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlieod
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was adequate. Elevator was dirty but that could be because of people carting food back to their rooms from the continental breakfast. The breakfast was enough to get us started each day. They had bagels, muffins, fruit, juices and coffee. One PC for internet usage was set up in the dining room seating area. Never had any problem accessing it. Shuttle runs back and forth from the airport on a regular basis. Close to the Eastwick regional rail station and several bus lines that can gert you to downtown Philladelphia. Rate was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great for travelers using Philadelphia Airport”
Reviews.Author: irishrose123
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Orlando from Scranton Pa. via Philadelphia Airport. I drove to Philadelphia and stayed the night before my flight left at this hotel. Their parking package allowed me to stay overnight, leave my car for a week and provided a shuttle to and from the airport for a very resonable fee. There was a nice continental breakfast included in the price. The manager is a very nice person and most of the staff are very warm and friendly. I will definitely travel this way again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price unfriendly desk staff”
Reviews.Author: ddpanthers76
Reviews.Content: Price was good even though tax was added to what we thought was final price. The management and desk staff were unfriendly to the point of being rude. The room they tried to give us did not match what we thought we had based on photos and description. This got fixed but they kept blaming us for the mix up. Location of hotel was excellent and the support staff (courtesy van driver, housekeeping, etc) were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: Theaterwiz
Reviews.Content: Nice location, was a bit messy but the problem was the staff. We arrived to check in to several people already complaining about the place. Our Highlights- -asked for two extra pillows, they could only give us one -No towels on the first day when room was cleaned, staff acted like it was our fault -Second day we tried to rent a movie on TV, from the room, took 3 trips to the front desk and several cuss words to rent a movie, for 11 bucks I might add -The third day we arrived back from a day of sightseeing to a room that was not cleaned, no towels etc. when we questioned the front desk they replied that it was not their responsibility, again, after several cuss words they had a maid come to clean the room -The whole towel issue was due to a fabric shower curtain that allowed all the water from the shower to flood the floor, thus requiring the need for every towel to sop up all the water every day

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for coupons, but the room was comfy!”
Reviews.Author: ixnayhombre
Reviews.Content: I found a coupon in a travel booklet for a $60 room - I only needed one night, so it was perfect. I arrived at 6AM and was told I couldn't use the coupon because I had come too early - to use the coupon you have to check in at 3pm and check out by noon the next day. The clerk instead gave me a "discounted" rate of $100 for the room from 6AM that day to noon the next day. Still not a bad deal, I guess. ABOUT THE ROOM: it had a funny smell (like brand new carpet or wallpaper) but I didn't notice it after five minutes of being in there. Really didn't ruin it for me. The windows opened for fresh air and the atmosphere controls worked great. The room was very clean, there were fresh sheets/towels all neatly folded, the bathroom was spotless. The beds were pretty comfy too. There is a "cold" continental breakfast with bagels/cream cheese, coffee, 4 kinds of cereal, fruit, packaged pastries/muffins, milk, and fruit juices. I gave it 3 stars because it IS a little older and clearly not a luxury stay. However, I was happy with my experience, its perfect for a 1 or 2 night sleep-only stay. ALSO watch out: the walls/ceiling are a little thin. I must have had children above me, I could hear thumpity thumps while awake. I'm a heavy sleeper, but it might be a bigger deal for others.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: jadfg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Microtel Philadelphia Airport for one night and found some of the negative reviews here on Tripadvisor very misleading. The room was admittedly a bit worn out, but I found it very clean and comfortable enough for the price I was paying. Complimentary shuttle service from the airport worked well - and free breakfast was an unexpected bonus. The hotel is close to the Eastwick station, where you can easily catch a train downtown. Overall the hotel served it's purpose and left me wondering whether some of the reviewers even stayed in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional.”
Reviews.Author: CarnivalCrusader
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for a very short period during a overnight airport connection. Rooms are of a typical US motel standard but are clean and comfortable for the price. We left on the 4am shuttle but the staff encouraged us to take coffee muffins and cereals from the breakfast room even though breakfast was not officially until 5.30. Minivan driver and night staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Word of warning - unlike every other hotel at PHL airport you have to call to get the free courtesy transport - we waited over 30 minutes before we called assuming it would just circulate!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and helpful...one of the few remaining smoking hotels!”
Reviews.Author: sm0kin
Reviews.Content: The Microtel Inn near the Philadelphia Airport has the most courteous employees. The front desk "Paul" made sure we had everything we needed for our three day stay. They were helpful when we needed extra towels and soap. We requested NO housekeeping service during our stay and they respected our wishes. This is one of the few hotels in the Philadelphia area that allow smoking in the room! I know that there are a lot of people that complain about smokers, to them...I say... stay in a 100% smoke free hotel...by my calculations, this is one of 5 in the Philadelphia area that caters to smokers. (Who, by the way -smokers-...are the most laid back people I know!)

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to the Microtel”
Reviews.Author: ayodelep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attempted to celebrate our anniversary at the Microtel hotel near the airport. We were treated like trash!!!! Because my husband is Jamaican the front desk employee by the name of Rajni insinuated that we needed a room to smoke something. After seeing our room, we noticed that it was still dirty. I let Rajni (the front desk employee) know , and he proceeded to yell, and disrespect us in front of other guest. Ultimately he kicked us out of the hotel at 12:30am for no reason. I've never been treated like this in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away. There has to be something better.”
Reviews.Author: RobSpi98
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Micotel in Phily. Trying to get a hotel under 100.00- and not find a dump. But...we found a dump. First of all, the staff was very uninterested in helping you check in, or do anything. The room they gave us was 101, a handicap room. nothing against handicapped, but the room was terrible. The bathroom shower nozzle would not stay up. To take a shower, we had to wedge a coffee stirrer in the thing to keep it from flopping down. The handle on the door was broken off, so it was very hard to get out of the bathroom once you were finished doing your business. Because the room was handicapped, there was no "lip" on the shower floor to keep water from running out into the bathroom. So, when you took a shower- the floor gathered a bunch of water. While on the bathroom.....there were no shelves or counters to set your stuff. not sure why that was. Also, we only had 2 sets of towels and wash cloths and had to go get 3 more. (we had 5 in our party). I know this is a microtel, but the room was very small, and very ordinary. Mirrors across the entire back wall, made you think the room was bigger....but it definilty was "micro". Breakfast was a joke. First of all, the nighttime help was on the "guest" computer looking for girls, and facebook, etc......instead of being behind the desk. Even when guests came down for breakfast, there he was surfing the internet. When I went to use the computer (when the phone rang and he had to get up), I had to close a bunch of foreign sites, in all kinds of strange languages. That tells you the type of workers at this place. The breakfast consisted of cereal with warm milk. Some bagels, and some juice. THAT IS IT. The coffee was not good either. So my recommendation is to spend a bit more, and stay across the parking lot at Hampton Inn. You will be happier- and better taken care of. I guess when you read Micro......it definitly means Micro!!!

Reviews.Title: “nope, nope, nope, nope”
Reviews.Author: dandds
Reviews.Content: Poorly maintained, and the smell--a combination of stale popcorn, dirty carpets, and smoke. Smokers have been disrespectful of this property--the bathroom surfaces were covered with cigarette burns. Bathroom floor had lots of long hair remaining after being mopped. bathroom sink took 10 minutes to drain.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, no bed bugs seen in our 3 rooms.”
Reviews.Author: KLK1024
Reviews.Content: Okay, we booked this stay through www.parksleepfly.com at a cheap price. We read reviews after booking and saw a lot saying that they saw bedbugs and it was a horrible experience. To be honest, this place was average. The staff were very friendly. The woman working at the front desk gave us so much information and was very helpful. We checked our beds thoroughly for bugs and didn't find any. The worst we found were hairs in the blanket and a stain on the windowseat. The continental breakfast was ready for us at 4am, including juice, muffins, bagels and coffee. The shuttle service was on time and accomodating. The driver was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT THE H#$! WAS I THINKING?????”
Reviews.Author: winniec1
Reviews.Content: NEVER, NEVER, NEVER, NEVER . . . stay at this rat hole of a hotel. The room was filthy--trash from previous guests left all over the room, black stuff on the sheets and pillow cases not to mention a huge footprint on the bed spread. Rust and crud all over the shower and bathroom fixtures. Hair and crumbs and stains on the bathroom floor not to mention my shoes stuck to the floor. The heater grate kept falling off. You get the picture. When I asked to change rooms as I couldn't stay in this one, I was told by the young woman reading a book at the desk that there wasn't one available. I decided to leave and sleep in an airport chair rather than stay in that garbage bin of a room. I checked out at 9:30 p.m. They show me leaving at 12:40 a.m. When I talked to the manager Harry, he was rude and totally unhelpful. I booked this room through hotelsbycity.com - they were less than helpful too. So, beware. This place needs a major clean up and maybe even a fumigation to get rid of the crap that must be living in those beds and carpets. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “lost reservation”
Reviews.Author: Buff2011
Reviews.Content: We had a late returning flight into Philadelphia after a tiring vacation and were looking forward to a good night's sleep before starting out on our 4 hour drive home. We had stayed at this same hotel the night before our trip and had confirmed our reservation for the return trip. Yet somehow they had no record of it. There were no rooms available and they offered no compensation for our inconvenience. And they expect to stay in business??

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Resnet
Reviews.Content: This stay was my worst hotel experience I have ever had. Crumbled peanuts were found on the sofa, liquid remained in the coffee pot, shampoo left by previous customer was not cleared off, and all three pillows were in the color of yellow! They were not the full story: While the front desk promised me a wake-up call 6am, the phone had been keeping silent until I jumped out of bed 7am to rush for my 8am flight!

Reviews.Title: “A mean hotel at Philly Airport”
Reviews.Author: Reiner71
Reviews.Content: This one is nothing special, an averaged airport stay for people not needing any means of luxury comfort. The continental breakfast wasn't really something to go for. I was disappointed a little bit as none of the pictures on the hotel's home page was showing the room we recently stayed in. The rooms would need a renewal, many of the furnishings are aged and look time-worn. At least it was acceptable at the rate we have paid. A recommendation for budget travellers only.

Reviews.Title: “If cleanliness is next to godliness, this place is unholy”
Reviews.Author: kittenjd2b
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before hand and thought this place would be okay for one night. Well, I guess so, but definitely not a minute more! We picked it because we had an early flight and the location was most convenient. In addition, parking your car is much cheaper than any other lot in the area. So if you have any early flight and not spending much time in the hotel, maybe you can stand it. Otherwise, this place REALLY is dirty! I was afraid to walk barefoot or even in stocking feet on the carpet. We didn't experience any bedbug bites. The walls were also grime-y. We were so tired we got into be with our clothes on - we were afraid to place them in the drawers! We left as quickly as possible in the morning. I don't think we will ever return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You'll save money but don't expect much else out of it.”
Reviews.Author: kewlmann07
Reviews.Content: I can't pretend like staying at this hotel was one of the worst experiences in my hotel-life but I'm not going to sit back and say it was great. Everything was really par for the most part. The rooms are pretty spacious and the giant wall to wall mirror makes the room seem even bigger. The view from the window isn't amazing but if you have a room facing the front of the hotel, you've got some nice greenery to look at. The service isn't all that friendly but also isn't terrible. There may not be many smiles and the front desk had a bit of a bad smell to it but I doubt that's the case every day (I was only there 2 days and 1 night). Bed-wise... the sheets seemed a little plastic and had a not very pleasant feeling to them and the mattress wasn't as good as it could have been but they were still okay enough to sleep on. The free breakfast is always nice but as usual, you need to get there early if you really want to get anything good. It could be better but I've had worse. All in all, what I'm trying to say is, it's not a terrible place to stay a night or two but you're not going to get the little extras that make the stay nice like at other places. I can't say it's good or bad but if you're goin for leisure and can afford spending a few extra bucks, I would go for a slightly more expensive hotel just to get the smiles, better food and more comfortable arrangements than par.

Reviews.Title: “used to be acceptable... but no way would I go back”
Reviews.Author: jeremywearsvans
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times before when I needed a really cheap place to stay. It used to be "Clean enough" but the last time I stayed it had gone down hill. I actually took the shirt I wore that day and put it on the pillow so my face wouldn't actually come in contact with it. I have had some wierd experiences at this hotel as well that most people would feel unsafe. One time I pulled up and saw a car sitting up front with windows smashed out of it. Another time there was a woman that was upset because her brother was there doing drugs. I can't say if he was actually doing that but the woman did say he was. Also if you do take a chance and stay there if you're flying into PHL you have to call them and tell them to pick you up. They don't patrol the airport regularly so remember that you'll need their phone number when you arrive. -JWV

Reviews.Title: “BAIT AND SWITCH TACTICS”
Reviews.Author: jrzygirl_10
Reviews.Content: Called hotel before arrival,was told they had plenty of rooms. Clerk at front desk quoted 3 different room rates,then checked again said those rooms were not available.Only a "suite" was left for a much higher price. Room was dirty,hair on bathroom floor,cigarette burns on sofa, stained sheets. Elevator & hallways were dingy,littered with debris,terrible odor of urine in corridors. Most horrible experience I've ever had in a hotel,the most unsanitary,rundown property that I've seen in my travels. When in the Philadelphia area, don't even THINK about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: mjwannabe
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. We went this month (Aug. 2010) and there was no air in the lobby. The desk clerk rudely told us to stand aside and wait to be called. 15 minutes later he finally called us up. The hotel was under my friend's name and they asked her to sign a sheet that was almost blank. She asked for a copy and they told her no, they aren't allowed to do that. Why not? They never would give us an acceptable explanation. There was a couple standing next to us who was complaining to another clerk. I heard the word "lawsuit" being thrown around by the husband. There's a bad sign. The entire hotel smelled weird. The carpet in our room felt damp. There were stains on the comforter (if you could even refer to it as a comforter). The toilet made a weird noise so we had to open the lid and jiggle the chain to get it to stop. We felt quite unsafe in the hotel. The only decent thing I can say about this hotel was the location. It was close to the airport. Other than that there is absolutely no way I would stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: scfsales
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in Philly thanks to the weather and was booked into this hotel with the "help" of Hotels.com. This was the most disgusting, filthy hotel I have ever been to, and I have traveled all over the world. The bathroom was not clean, there were drips of something on the wall and the carpet had not been cleaned. There was cat littler on the floor. I lasted about 10 minutes, went back downstairs and told them I wanted my money back, which they refused to do, and found another hotel (the aloft- great hotel!). Hotels.com did refund my money, but I'll never book with then again since they put me in that dump in the first place!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE URINE SMELL”
Reviews.Author: BBlinda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to say at that hotel because we had to get an early flight back to Denver and it was one of the closest ones to the airport. To make you understand how bad it was, we only lasted 4 hours at that hotel. As we went in the room we noticed a very strong smell of urine. We were so tired that tried to ignore it but woke up at 3:35am and we just left and ended up waiting at the airport. Never again will I stay at a Microtel. NEVER! This would be the second time we stayed in one the other one was in Bozeman Montana and it did have a urine smell as well but not as severe as this one, so it basically means these hotels are not managed properly by the company,

Reviews.Title: “Vary bad hotel i have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: stevejohn1234
Reviews.Content: me and my family were staying at microtel. we had early flight around 5am in the morning. when we entered in the room, it was vary dirty. the bed was not made and there is dust everywhere on carpet. then we went to front desk to change the room. the front desk guy Sayal is vary rude person. he said we dont have another room as we are sold out..we pay $116 for the room and we getting dirty room to stay??? the room was smelling vary bad. The airport shuttle driver is vary nasty. and asking me for a tip when he drop me at the airport. NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ideal for Middle School Overnight”
Reviews.Author: akey1101
Reviews.Content: The Microtel seems your typical layover hotel: basic, no frills, bed-shower-TV-breakfast kind of vibe. I interacted with a few other guests who seemed very happy with their stay. However, we were not the Microtel's typical clientele: we were 31 sixth graders and 5 chaperones, down from New York on a whirlwind sightseeing extravaganza. As such, I do not think the Microtel was an ideal place to lay our little heads. The lack of connecting doors meant lots of late-night hallway sitting for chaperones. They couldn't give us adjacent rooms, though we were all on the same hallway--I felt bad for the patrons staying on either side of us, though the kids were pretty well-behaved. We also had to unexpectedly rent a suite so we could get an L of rooms that one chaperone could monitor--kind of an inconvenience. There's also no ball room, pool or common area, aside from the lobby, where we could gather the kids in one place away from the other patrons. The TVs were high up and didn't allow for DVD or video game hook-ups. Breakfast was plentiful, and the staff was very responsive with things like extra towels. The rooms did have a cushioned window seat that could double as a bed for students reluctant to share or generous chaperones willing to give up their beds. Nevertheless, I would still urge anyone planning a large school trip to seek other accommodations--I know we will next time around.

Reviews.Title: “They understand their market”
Reviews.Author: EIEIOOO
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel. Notice it says 2 star. But the manangement understands that they are close to the airport and they provide good service for the traveler who gets stuck in Philidelphia. Free shuttle, free breakfast, free wifi. Not the Hilton but I keep their number in my phone because if you travel through PHL things will go wrong sooner or latter and you will be looking for a room. I called at 8:30 and they picked me up at 8:45 and had me in a room by 9pm. That is what they do well. Please don't ask them to act like a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: n1c01ew
Reviews.Content: The Microtel in Philadelphia was the dirtiest, most uncomfortable place I've ever stayed at. the people who worked there were extremely rude, and customer service wasn't exactly something they were strong in. Our room smelled like pee so bad that we had to go buy a can of Lysol. The beds had stains on them, and the bathroom was still dirty from the people before us. It seemed like they tried to make it LOOK like it had been cleaned without actually cleaning it. DO NOT stay here if you don't like sleeping in other peoples' bodily fluids accompanied by the aroma of urine. Trust me. Shell out an extra 20 bucks and stay at one of the other hotels; it will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beg Bugs”
Reviews.Author: lajollabob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Microtel Philadelphia Airport three consecutive nights in early May, 2010. After the first night I noticed two little bites on my left hand, but attributed them to the small spiders that are found almost everywhere. The two subsequent mornings more appeared, but I was too busy sightseeing to pay them as much attention as they deserved. It was not until during my flight home after the third night that both arms began to itch badly, and having on a light jacket, I scratched without thinking. Upon arrival home late at night on Monday I took off my jacket to find both arms bloody from the scratching and covered with bites ranging in size from pencil lead to a dime. The following morning on the Internet I looked up â€œBug Bitesâ€�, discovering that mine matched exactly those shown for Bedbugs. The article further stated that one piece of evidence showing the presence of Bedbugs is small dots of blood on the sheets, which I had noticed after my second night at the hotel, but dismissed as being from the previous tenant, as it appeared that the sheets had been washed subsequently, although faint red dots were still visible. More bites appeared that day and for three days thereafter on my arms, chest, back, and buttocks, finally totaling more than 250 - but I dared not scratch in spite of the awful itching. Although I treated them with antibiotic and cortisone ointments, more bites continued to appear. It is well known that some insect bites (like many jellyfish stings such as the Thimble) do not manifest themselves immediately, but can take hours or even days to emerge. Finding online the Microtel Headquarters phone number for Customer Service, I called to report the problem at 3:00 PM EDT on Wednesday, but when told that none of the supervisors was available, I left a message for one of them on voice mail outlining my problem. That Friday, not having heard from Microtel, I called again at 3:00 PM EDT, to be told that all supervisors had already left for the weekend. The following Tuesday I received a letter from a supervisor whose theme was â€œWe sincerely apologize that your expectations of Microtel Domesticâ€™s high standards of guest service were not met.â€� Upon reading this icy form letter (which was not even signed - just a typed signature), I immediately called the sender, who informed me that the hotel at which I had stayed was merely a franchise, and that I would have to deal directly with the owner (in Maryland with no 800 number) for any further action. When I told her this seemed unfair, she said she would have the franchise owner call me. It has now been two weeks since that conversation, with no word from him. Not being the litigious type, I have decided just to post this message on TripAdvisor in the hope it will prevent future travelers from suffering the same fate as I, and to let them know how the Microtel Headquarters treats clients.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and great shuttle service.”
Reviews.Author: EricaMusky207
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here due to having an early flight out of Philly. I was a little nervous due to some of the reviews here. But when we checked in, the staff was friendly and helpful. When we checked into the room, I did a quick scan over the whole room. Although it's a little outdated, it was clean. We woke up early to catch the shuttle service and grabbed a snack at the continental breakfast. Not a huge variety but still has enough to fill our bellies and not have to pay for overpriced airport food. The shuttle took 5 minutes to get to the airport, which is was wonderful! And we were picked up rather quickly after we arrived. For the amount that we would have paid just for parking alone, I definitely would say the Microtel is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: cath102
Reviews.Content: Early flight on Saturday, decided to go the day before. Was not sorry, the hotel was clean, breakfast okay for the price & shuttle service to the airport was the best. Coming back to pick up our car, driver was so nice & we did not have to wait. Easy on/off for 95.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the dirtiest hotel I hve...”
Reviews.Author: Rary19
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the dirtiest hotel I hve ever stayed in. It smelled horrible tht whn I went to get on the plane people asked wht tht smell was. Dipika was the rudest person I hve ever met. She couldn't speak english at all except when she excepted payment. So if u feel like having a horrible hotel stay by all means wit Dipika.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable bargin hotel”
Reviews.Author: emily1108
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to catch an early morning flight, and we were very satisfied as it served the purpose well and was VERY cheap. The bed was very comfortable. As far as the noise, we didn't notice much (but we habitually take ear plugs with us to hotels just in case). The cleanliness was fine, with the exception of dust and hairs along the baseboard of the bathroom. The shuttle to and from the airport was very prompt and easy to use (they gave us a business card with detailed instructions). We left eariler than breakfast was served (starts at 5:30 AM), but they have coffee and tea 24 hours a day, and had dry goods out for breakfast at least by 3:30 AM (bagels, muffins, cereal with milk). The manager was very helpful about telling us how to use the public transportation. It is just a short walk to the bus stop (the R1 train was closed for service; bus #37 goes by the hotel twice and hour; tickets are $2 each way or one can get a pass / pay on the bus with exact change; we got off at the end of the bus line at Snyder and Broad and took the orange line subway at the bus stop to City Hall to see the Liberty Bell, etc.). We ate dinner at Ruby Tuesday, which is also just a short walk from the hotel. The hotel seemed safe. Our car was there while we were gone and it was fine. One thing we really liked is that the manager said "long term" parking was in the back of the hotel, but we could park our car anywhere in the parking lot we felt comfortable leaving it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed and expected”
Reviews.Author: Scottie061
Reviews.Content: This hotel goes out of its way to provide a clean, comfortable and convenient stopover for travelers. The shuttle service was perfect, a very good continental breakfast with complimentary USA Today was available even at 4 a.m. for an early flight, the room design and amenities were A-1, and the staff were helpful and efficient. All this at a reasonable price. We would definitely use Microtel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great public transportation access”
Reviews.Author: misheep
Reviews.Content: 3mins walk to SEPTA airport line -- Eastwick station. clean, cheap, convenient public transportation. That is all I want from a Motel

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Filty, and front desk service was horrible.”
Reviews.Author: kimy112170
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for an early morning flight out of Philadelphia we paid 90.00 for this room. The room was FILTY. The beds both looked like they were never made from the last persons staying there. There was pubic hair on most of the pillow cases (looked like someone walked on the pillows or did whatever on them" and the beds and some "stains" on the sheets. We slept with all our clothing on, did not use the bathroom because that was disgusting too. There were stains and dirt all over the wall by the garbage can. When checking in the manager at the front desk gave us a non smoking room when we ordered a smoking room, he argued saying that we requested non smoking, we took the conformation print out down to him and he still argued. DO NOT USE THIS DUMP!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this motel”
Reviews.Author: Penny109
Reviews.Content: My husband and two friends utilized the Microtel for the third time in four years as a Park and Fly stay and found the motel extremely lacking in all categories. This is not the same motel we have stayed in previously. Something has changed it over the last two years. It is sloven in appearance; the rooms are minimally clean. There were minor, but unnecessary, problems checking in. The breakfast is less than hearty. The only nearby restaurant in the location (which is semi-industrial) now has a security guard stationed at the door. Not good but worth putting up with for one night, prior to flying out of Philadelphia. The main problems was that our vehicle was broken into while we were on our travels. We were contacted on our ship to be told our companions cell phones had been found by the New Jersey police in a parking lot there, along with some small bags. When contacted, the Microtel could not say whether the vehicle was stolen or if it remained on the lot. Upon our return around 1am, it became apparent that the ignition was missing and we waited for 2 hours for a family member and a ride back to Maryland. I will not describe what we observed during that time. But it confirmed our desire to avoid this motel at all cost in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 1 night stay when stopping over in Philadelphia.”
Reviews.Author: Onavoyage28
Reviews.Content: Pros - comfy bed, cheap room, great shuttle service, breakfast, very convenient overall, decent tv channels, near ruby tues restaurant. Cons - dirty bathroom, dirty mirror near bed.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Microtel Inns and Suites.”
Reviews.Author: travel2610
Reviews.Content: Very dissatisfied with condition of micro room. Surfaces were not cleaned properly (old food resdiue dried up and spilled coffee). Notified housekeeping, promptly responded and cleaned. Another visit to front desk to have housekeeping return to room. Desk surface also was not cleaned at all (old cup or bottle rings on desk, hair of all other types, hair in ice bucket and on tray). And too top it off the heater vent full of dust and when turned on dust particles noticeable. The carpet not vaccumed well (hair balls and dust balls noted). Although houskeeping was prompt, the room should have been properly cleaned before allowing guests in. Know I am uneasy about sleeping on the bed, will not take a shower, reluctant to use bathroom and will not book again with Microtel. Unsatisfied with front desk clerk and check in process. All this on top of inclement weather, which I dealt with well. But the room was just ridiculously unappealing.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a solution......”
Reviews.Author: Cabana-Boy-and-Girl
Reviews.Content: We have searched for a solution to air travel from PHL for sometime now and have tried several hotels. This hotel fills the bill for us. Hourly service to the airport, on demand pick-up and under $100 a night (7 day parking included). There is a Ruby Tuesday within walking distance for dinner, the staff here seems compentent, the rooms clean, and our car was still there in the lighted lot when we returned from an 8 day trip. It is what it is, but we have paid a lot more for the same service. The complimentary breakfast will not cause you to write home about it, but it provided what you need to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Bed Bugs Infestation!! Not worth staying here!”
Reviews.Author: jello82
Reviews.Content: I chose Microtel PHL because it's cheap, right next to PHL, free wifi, free breakfast, free airport shuttle. Ok those are all the good things. Kind of. I was sitting on the couch in the room for several hours studying, until I realized there were these little bugs crawling all over my sweatshirt. I had never seen these little creatures and figured maybe they were some kind of little oval 5mm blackish brown cockroaches. I noticed there were some black specks (later i realized they were bed bug feces) on the bed too. Later on after being bitten overnight about ten different places on my body, leaving huge red itchy welts. I did some online research and saw pictures of bed bugs and realized that place has a hugee bed bug infestation. I am never staying somewhere cheap like this again. Microtel please take care of this problem. I have now brought back some of my new bed bug friends to my own home (they must have attached to my suitcase ) and am suffering at home with new bug bites everyday. Apparently these things are an extreme pain to get rid of and there are no good treatments so I'm trying all these different things under the sun. In addition, the continental breakfast is alright. They had cereal, bagels, oatmeal and muffins. I ate some cereal. I tried a bagel but it tasted stale. I opened up a cream cheese to maybe hide the flavor but the cream cheese had separated into a layer of oil and cream, so I dumped that idea.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising good”
Reviews.Author: shoredude2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 5 minutes from the airport and has a 24 hour shuttle. No refrigerator or microwave. The room is small and uses the mirror makes the room seem bigger trick to the extreme. There was a mirror the length of the wall between the beds. Kind of creepy in a sexual way. Otherwise the hotel was very good. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was very clean. Room also had a charming little window seat. And the price was under half what some of the other hotels nearby were charging. Would definitely stay there again if the need arose.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a night near the airport”
Reviews.Author: OllieC03
Reviews.Content: We were visiting New York for a few days and could not get a direct flight so flew to Philadelphia. Arrived late in the evening so spent a night here. We were picked up from the airport and the hotel is only a 5min drive away. The room was easily spacious enough for 4 adults. Complimentary tea and coffee and bagels and cereal in the morning. Just a 5 min walk to the rail station and then 15 mins into the City. For just Â£53 a night for the four of us I think it was unbeatable for value and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF”
Reviews.Author: PArick
Reviews.Content: When I booked hotel they told me free parking for seven nights when you park and fly.When I checked in they said I had to pay for parking so I told managerI booked this room with free parking.I signed for the price that was agreed on my cedit card. When I got my credit card statement they charged me a higher price.This place is a RIP OFF. DO NOT GO BOOK ANY ROOMS HERE.THEY ARE CROOKS

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: westcoasttraveler71
Reviews.Content: Downtown Philly was pretty spendy so my sister and I decided to stay by airport and travel by train into town. Rates were very reasonable. Motel was quiet, location was within easy walking distance to train depot, motel offered courtesy shuttle to and from airport. Free breakfast was more than adequate and a great Ruby Tuesday was just across the parking lot. Staff was courteous and very helpful. Free long distance phone calls and internet use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for an early flight; clean & friendly & well-priced”
Reviews.Author: bug76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a concert and in anticipation of an early flight out of PHL. Excellent! For a great price, we had a clean room, breakfast ready & prompt & efficient shuttle service to PHL. Not exactly where you'd want to spend a vacation, but for flights in/out of PHL or a park/sleep/fly option, I'd certainly choose this place again. Very friendly front desk service and breakfast is decent - your typical continental fare with bagels, cereal, coffee & juice. (As a note, I gave this hotel an excellent review, but given its purpose for our stay - needing an airport hotel...again, i wouldn't give it an excellent review if this is where i were spending a one week beach vacation...just to give some perspective!)

Reviews.Title: “Management and Staff are HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: solstammy
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have ever written and I travel a great deal. We were left standing at the airport for nearly an hour. We made 3 calls to them to inquire. That is not what really made me blow my top. On the last call, their staff stated I had never called them!!!! He continued to argue with me and pretty much called me a liar. He continued this behavior during my check-in. When I called the manager Bob Pattel to report my outrage at the way his staff treated me and the one hour wait at the airport, he pawned me off to someone else who didn't really care.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: brucer1
Reviews.Content: Had no reservation anywhere & others around were sold-out,(this a busy airport so do recommend reservations if you want to stay around airport)Room was a little smokey but tolerable,The front desk was great,cost $85 with AAA discount.Shuttle is 10 minute ride to airport,run about every half-hour. The restaurant (the only one) nearby is good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: KristinKJ
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned after reading some reviews but the Microtel was perfect for the us. We landed late at night, there was free phones near the luggage area with the hotel on speed dial. We were picked up after a 10 minute wait, the check in was just as easy. The driver of the airport shuttle was friendly and took my husband back to the airport to get our delayed luggage. The room had two double beds, it was fairly big and had a decent bathroom. The fridge made a little bit of noise at night and we could hear some traffic in the morning. There was a big tv in the room and there is a restaurant a short walk away. You can also order take away food to be delivered to the hotel. There is free breakfast in the morning, consisting of bagels and muffins, juice, coffe, tea and cereal. Overall, this was a perfect hotel for us at an affordable price. Free internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a Night Either Before or After Your Flight”
Reviews.Author: fluffnfold
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before an early flight. It was fine for that purpose. The standard room is quite small, so I wouldnâ€™t want to spend any significant time there. Maybe the larger rooms/suites that have the sofa, wet bar, mini fridge are better. My only real issue with the hotel was the temperature of the rooms and public spaces--it was HOT! The air in our room brought in air from the outside, which was cool, but humid. If it had been hot outside, the room would have been stifling. As it was, we just had to deal with the humidity. We called down to the front desk about this, and we were asked what type of air-con unit was in the room. Apparently, some of the rooms have a newer digital system, which ours did not. The location is great--about 7 minutes from the airport, so youâ€™re there in no time. The shuttle worked well, although they run only every 30 minutes. The hotel is in a complex with a Hampton Inn, Courtyard Marriott (or maybe it was a Fairfield), and an Embassy Suites. There is a Ruby Tuesdays within walking distance of all those hotels, along with the Embassy Grille at the Embassy Suites. The included continental breakfast was a little disappointing, but to be honest, we tried to eat at 5:00 am and it didnâ€™tâ€™ officially begin until 5:30 (this was a weekday; Iâ€™m not sure if weekend hours differ). There were packaged bagels and muffins, but no cold beverages. There was a juice machine with three kinds of juices, but it wasnâ€™t turned on. I think there was also cereal, but no fresh fruit or healthy options. The hotel seems maintained, and there are pretty flowers surrounding the entrance. Itâ€™s what you would expect from a Microtel--no more and no less. We got a â€œpark, sleep, and flyâ€� rate here of just over $100, which included the room and 7 days parking--a good deal, since parking at PHL canâ€™t be found (even offsite) for much less than $9 per day.I would stay here again if I could be sure the air-conditioning worked in any season--I like my room chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed prior to early flight. Fine accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mr621
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Microtel by the Philly airport because it was easier to get up and go to an early flight from right across route 95 from the airport. The accomodations were fine. It was clean, there was a working tv and a bathroom. All we really needed for the cheap stay we wanted. The 24 hour shuttle worked out well at 5 am and there was a nice spread for breakfast. The staff was friendly and we experienced no problems. It is true, you get what you pay for and we were happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mzhelen
Reviews.Content: Room itself was acceptable, although the tv platform wouldn't swivel as it should, so you couldn't watch tv from the sofa, only from the bed. The breakfast majorly disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “For a Stay, Park and Fly room, it was fine”
Reviews.Author: NYDinette
Reviews.Content: We chose this for the Stay, Park and Fly option, and even though we were there less than 24 hours, it worked for us. Convenient location to the airport with prompt shuttle drivers who were helpful with baggage. It's not the most appealing room we've ever stayed in, but with a continental breakfast and free parking for up to 14 days, really, it's a decent deal if all you want to do is crash before an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “New Meaning to "Don't Let the Bedbugs Bite"!”
Reviews.Author: cathyb53
Reviews.Content: I'm not kidding - BED BUGS!! While this hotel seemed marginally OK, I came home with BED BUG BITES! Yes! I'd read that they were becoming more common in the US & UK, but I honestly didn't expect to encounter them in a respectable national hotel chain. And I am not happy about it! Rooms are expensive in Philly, and many places I would have preferred to stay during this last-minute trip were booked. I had had previous positive stays with Microtel hotels (though not this one), and so I went with this place, booked through Expedia. I should have kept looking! Cleanliness here seemed kind of casual at best; I had noticed that my sheets were not changed daily (and my garbage wasn't even emptied daily, which should have been a tip-off), but I was in town because of a medical emergency with my daughter so I wasn't really paying that much attention to the hotel. The front-desk staff were helpful about directions & calling taxis when I needed them, and I thought that all I needed was a safe, clean-enough, inexpensive-but-decent place to sleep. But when I got home & discovered the rash covering my sides, arms & legs, and consulted with my doctor and internet resources, to learn that I had been bitten by bedbugs - well, it just makes my skin crawl! And of course the extra expense & nuisance of getting an accurate diagnosis (hey, at least it wasn't a rare flesh-eating bacteria as I had feared it might be!), repeated hot-water washing of everything that had been in my suitcase to be sure I wasn't bringing any bugs into my home, and the huge "Yuck Factor" all add up to make this an expensive as well as disgusting hotel stay. I won't forget it, that's for sure! I will NEVER stay here again, or at any Microtel, and I recommend that you don't either. I have not yet contacted the management about the situation - I need to cool down a bit first - but you can bet I will do so. I would expect that I would receive a full refund, but somehow I doubt it wil happen that way. (And no, I do NOT want an offer from them of a free night's stay....)

Reviews.Title: “It's what I expected from a Microtel”
Reviews.Author: Steph-n-Karl
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but clean and efficient. Grabbed a muffin and coffee for breakfast before heading out. Perfect for an overnight stay before an early flight. The shuttle took us to the airport with no problems. After we got our bags and headed to the pick-up area, I called the number on the card they gave us from my cell phone and they were there to pick us up in 20 minutes. As soon as we waved to the Microtel van (you really gotta keep an eye out for them though as many vans that were similar went by), the guy rolled up to us and loaded up our luggage. We were happy to see our car was still ok after hearing that there were recent break ins and vandalism in the row of hotels near the Microtel. The van driver told us that there were some people caught for those incidents recently.

Reviews.Title: “front desk”
Reviews.Author: blond60
Reviews.Content: The phone to have the shuttle come to get you from terminal E did not work, so after waiting 45 minutes and the shuttle driving past us we had to call a taxi. The front desk people were rude. We booked into another hotel at $40 less per room and were happier. We took the local bus transit (close by) to the airport at $2.00 per person, as recomended by the front desk. N

Reviews.Title: “OK, Good Price and Location.”
Reviews.Author: Amishcowboy
Reviews.Content: Nice Location, 1 mile from Airport. good value if you just wanna stay overnight for a Early Morning Flight. They have a free Shuttle that runs every half hour to Airport. You can also park in the lot for $7.50 a day. Ruby Tuesday is the only place near for a bite to eat, within Walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel cheap and close to PHL”
Reviews.Author: HAMDA_SECONDARY
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Car Window Smashed and Items Stolen”
Reviews.Author: yvi
Reviews.Content: The weather was really bad in Phila, snow, ice, sleet etc. I missed my flight and was rebooked for a 6:50AM flight. Instead of trying to drive back to my home (1 hour away), I called Hotwire and booked this room for 59 +tax. Well- it was my first Microtel experience and will be my LAST! The hotel room itself is not bad, but the clientelle is questionable. yes, airline personnel stay there but you will hear slamming doors and traffic in the hallway. I was excited about the airport shuttle and got the bright idea to park there instead of paying airport parking rates. Big MISTAKE! When I returned my passenger side window was smashed out and items were stolen. I reported it to the hotel, and they gave me the phone to call the police. The manager was not in. They told me they have signs stating they are not responsible. I asked about security cameras and was told they have them but not in the direction of my car - and will have to talk to the manager. NEVER AGAIN! It is not worth it to save a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: bikeguyatl
Reviews.Content: This is a good value if you don't plan on spending a lot of time in the room. Although small, the room was clean and quiet and included an iron. The only problem I had with the room was the lights for reading were very bright fluorescents, and the room didn't have a single lamp. Since I was only in the room for sleeping, the room was fine for my purposes and very convenient to the airport. One other problem is that the hotel lacks enough parking places, so many quests are forced to park on the grass or along the curb.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: RandyRandy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were on an overnight connection through PHL on our way to the Caribbean. We were going to be in the room for no more that 8 or 9 hours total. Therefore we had no need to spend a lot of money nor did we need any special amenities, just clean comfortable accommodations near the airport with a shuttle. The Microtel fit the bill just fine. Pick up at the terminal took no more time than normal, check in was swift and courteous. The room was small, the bed was okay, the bathroom clean. Complimentary morning coffee in the lobby was piping hot and ready to go. Check out was just as swift and courteous, the shuttle whisked us back to the terminal in no time at all. Under similar circumstances we wouldn't hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: santapoopalot
Reviews.Content: All the front desk person are very rude. They need to be trained more on how to be curteous to guest. Room was clean. Breakfast could have been better than just cereal and bagel.

Reviews.Title: “bargain basement lodging”
Reviews.Author: Awarely
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here in November. The check-in host was dressed as a maintenance man (which I assume he was), the toilet seat would not stay up (not an issue for women) because the fixture was installed too close to a ledge/lip that could not be moved, and I found a hair in my sink first thing! Things got better, however. The room was comfortable, it was relatively modern, and the towels and soap/shampoo were there, although sparse. (nothing but soap and shampoo) There was plenty of free parking (not available in center city). I did not try the continental breakfast since I had a breakfast meeting elsewhere, but several men were seated in the eating area and appeared satisfied. I hope I can afford a better place, next time, but this place will do if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Not Luxury but Affordable”
Reviews.Author: timekid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Microtel-Philadelphia Airport for two nights while on a business trip. I rented a two-queen bed room to save cost. Philadelphia is expensive for lodging and every extra dollar I spend eats into my profit. My initial impressions were very positive: clean, friendly. When I returned to my room late in the evening on the second day, however, I was unhappy to find that the level of cleaning was less than it should be. For example, the carpet was not vacuumed adequately and had small items left on it in some spots. The counter in the bathroom could have shined more. It seemed to have a bit of a soap scum from the night before. I had two frustrations with my room--outside of the typical built-in Microtel desk. 1.) The toilet continually cycled and ran. It would be quiet for five minutes and then run briefly and be quiet. I had to sleep with the bathroom door closed. 2.) The internet connection was quite good the first night but slowed to a virtually unusable crawl for the second night and early the next morning. A few positives: 1.) The breakfast was a little better than the typical Microtel or Super 8 fare. 2.) The area felt secure. 3.) The bed was comfortable. 4.) The room was not quite as "micro" as some Microtels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and a good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChriss
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a meeting in Philly and needed a room near the airport for one night. The on-site airport hotel wanted more than $200, which was much more than I wanted to pay. All I needed was a place to sleep and prepare for my meeting. I investigated the other nearby options, and learned that a Microtel was just off the airport grounds. I reserved a room for $90/night through an online booking service. I have stayed at other Microtel hotels, and had a pretty good idea what to expect. Other reviews at Tripadvisor raised some concerns for me, but I decided to give it a try. The Microtel Philadelphia Airport is actually more than I expected, and it's still a great value. First, you need to know the Microtel way. The hotels are simple designs with basic decorations. The rooms tend to be just large enough for the basics. The rates being charged are modest, so don't expect a fitness room, lavish breakfast and room service at midnight. You can expect a clean, comfortable room and a hotel staff that is courteous and helpful. The floor coverings and wallpaper -- in the room and in the common areas -- were all in very good condition. While simple and somewhat neutral, they were pleasing and did not look cheap or gaudy. The building is an equal-length L shape. My room faced into the L and the parking lot. One out-of-the-L side faces Bertram Rd., which is a major road. It's possible that there could be some traffic noise, but I don't know personally. He lobby is small, but clean. There is a moderately sized breakfast area that also has a desk with a computer for Internet access. I did not use the machine because I brought my own laptop. The vending machines and ice machine are just off the lobby. My room measured 10' by 12' for the bed area, and 6' by 9' for the bathroom. There is a short entrance area (about 6' by 3') as well. This sounds small, but it's not cramped with a queen bed. Microtel hotels tend to follow the European room size idea. It's not a suite or a place to host a crowd. It's a bedroom, which is all I need. The room has an armoire to hang clothes, a desk area, night stands, and a window seat. There are two drawers and the air conditioner below the window seat. Overall, it's a very efficient use of the space. The window seat was actually a nice spot to sit in while I watched TV for a bit. My room was a non-smoking room. Each time I entered the room, I smelled some kind of air freshener aroma. It was sort of a sweet lemon scent. It was a somewhat odd scent, but it only took a minute to get used to it. There is wireless Internet access throughout the hotel. My room was at the end of the hallway, and the signal strength was very low. The connection speed was slower than typical high-speed access, and while the data rate was shown to be 54Mb/s, I think the combination of other users and the low signal resulted in the slower connection. For basic e-mail and a few small file transfers, it was fine. The free continental breakfast is the typical style at a budget hotel: juice, cold and hot cereal, bagels, muffins, coffee. The breakfast area was kept clean, despite the sloppy ways of many of the guests. The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from the airport. When I landed, I called the hotel to request a pickup. I waited for 30 minutes and the shuttle never arrived, so I called again. I was told that the shuttle was on the way. It arrived 10 minutes later. I asked the driver (Chris) about the delay, and he said that he was never told about my first call. That's one strike against the staff, but it's the only strike I experienced. Later, I was able to arrange a ride to Ft. Miflin with the shuttle, which made up for the pickup error. There are a Hampton Inn and a Fairfield Inn next door. The only restaurant in walking distance is a Ruby Tuesday. There is a Metro stop (Eastwick Station) a very short walk (five minutes) away. If the shuttle service is not to your liking, take the Metro to the airport. You can also take the Metro into downtown Philly. The Metro stop is a huge convenience for this hotel. This is a much longer review than I normally write, but I feel that this hotel is a great value in a pretty good location. Some other reviews gave this hotel low marks, but I disagree. I rarely give a full 5 rating (I save that for truly outstanding experiences), so don't confuse my 4 rating as being a problem. The Microtel Philadelphia Airport easily lives up to realistic expectations. (CS)

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eaglesfan04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Microtel - Philadelphia Airport for six nights while visiting family and friends. The hotel was clean and the service was excellent. We'll definately stay there again on our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Try elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: luvs2goPa_
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fairly clean but extremly stark. Check in was without incident. Forget about breakfast as part of price. Stale doughnuts, no milk for stale cereal, bad coffee, OJ was nostly water with a birt of color....BAD!! Shuttle ran very late, missed flight. Try Hampton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Philadelphia Microtel Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: DIVERZZ
Reviews.Content: My CAR was stolen from thier parking lot! Bring a clunker if you do stay here that isn't even wanted for parts. I was driving an old but nice Buick station wagon. They stole it for parts, the cops said. The cops told us dont even think you'll get it back. We went in expecting help or assitstance of some kind, we were sadly mistaken. The only thing they did was to give a call to police. The nite mgr told me its happened before a couple times. But they still record over every day the camera (if it even works) tape must be for towel thieves. The driver was the managers girl friend and she was very help full dropped me off at a car rental that was closed. gave me the managers business card assured me he'd help & c/b. I'm sure good intentioned but no call and no help. end of story Dont expect your car that you pay to park thier to be thier when you get back from a lovely vacation at this motel, nor clean rooms, nor unsmelly rooms! to be fair I had a roof over my head that didn't leak on me but then again it didn't rain either. Nor to get your money you paid for to have the car parked thier given back either! CRAPPY, ROTTEN Philadelphia microtel Inn & suites? SUITE WHAT A LAUGH !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The manager at the time was Gregory Twyford Ps. I did 1 week later get call from police and got most of the car back. missing electronic parts door, window, seat, broken, battery gone, tires gone, dented. Ps I just want to let other people to look if you see the sign thier not responcible they really are not and the cameras are for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: mamaNewJersey
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was horrible. The free parking they advertise is misleading. The FREE parking is only for the the amount of nights you stay at the hotel. The check -in clerk was very rude. When we returned from our vacation and called to be picked up at the airport, we waited over 35 minutes to be picked up. When the van arrived, the van driver kept changing his story as to why it took so long. This is not a reliable hotel and I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for a pre-flight park and fly”
Reviews.Author: delacruzzer
Reviews.Content: We wanted a decent stay for a very early morning flight out of the Philadelphia airport. We got exactly what we needed from this Microtel Inn. The room was clean and nice enough. As some of the reviews here have stated, the walls are thin, and although we were lucky to not have any large groups, parties or loud people staying around us, when a neighbor would go to open their door it did sound as if someone was trying to open OUR door. There is a Ruby Tuesdays within a couple of blocks (walkable); anything else would require driving. We left too early to have the continental breakfast, but the space looked OK, the coffee was fine. There is a computer with supposedly highspeed internet acess. It was dog-slow, so I'm not sure what the 'highspeed' was - slower than the slowest DSL, but faster than dial-up...maybe satellite? The shuttle to the airport was prompt taking us there and picking us up; they took us right to our car on returning. For the price, it was definitely worthwhile for a decent night sleep, the parking , and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “When inexpensive equal CHEAP”
Reviews.Author: Zumtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel assumes that a bargain means a CHEAP staying experience. Extremely poor service. Walls are paper thin. The airport shuttle is slow and unreliable. My family waited for a full hour for a shuttle that the desk repeatedly said is "on its way." Do yourself a favor and pony up the extra twenty bucks for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs and sleeping pills”
Reviews.Author: letmesleeeep
Reviews.Content: ok, I booked it through expedia and obviously they erased the negative reviews. This hotel is a great budget hotel, I'm sitting here right now in my room and am enjoying the slow wireless internet, but at least it's free. Everything's fine, clean, friendly service and easily accessible by train (18 min to downtown) and it would be great - if only the walls were better. I hear every whisper, every slamming door, every step of people walking by as if they were walking through my room. If you're a light sleeper stay away from this place, you'll be frustrated. Some people who stay here have no respect and yell and shout in their rooms or watch TV as if they were deaf. When I asked to have a quiet room the reception guy said "sure" and gave me this room in the middle of kids and noise. Not very nice of him, but why should he care?! Other than that it's ok. Luckily the Ruby Tuesday is right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain - it was a nice price”
Reviews.Author: JennInWA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine, it served it's purpose as we arrived late and had to catch a very early flight home. The value was much better than others right around it, but I don't think I'd recommend it for a lengthy stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: winhtin
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family for four nights and found the experience to be very pleasant. I was a little concerned after reading reviews of other people but because I have really paid for it already I was ready to take the chance. I drove there from Erie, PA and I stayed near the airport because of the convenient location, since I am very familiar with Philadelphia. It served my purposes excellently since I was away most parts of the day but also close enough to return for a short daytime stay. The hotel was well kept and it was a very busy weekend which made it difficult for the breakfast area to be immaculate. The room was in very good condition and the bedding is in great condition. I did not have to use the shuttle but I saw the regular departures to the airport. I want to add my two cents worth since unsatisfied clients are more apt to write nasty reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Park & Fly motel”
Reviews.Author: mjp51us
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel for the "park & fly" feature as we would be away for 13 days. You can park your car there for up to 14 days with staying the night. We stayed on 7/31/06. The motel is nice. We had a 2 queen size beds, but they were hard as rocks, we did not get a good night sleep. The room was very nice and lots of room. All was clean. We got up for the shuttle to the airport, but here they should have had a signup sheet for how many people were interested in a 5am shuttle. There were quite a few people lined up. They had shuttles leaving on the hour and half hour. The first shuttle driver said they were getting more shuttles to come ASAP. The next one arrived in 10 mintues. So that did help getting the people to the airport in a timely manner. The cost of the "Park & Fly" was $170.00 plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “It's true.”
Reviews.Author: BayArea007
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here b/c it was the only place I could find when US Airways wouldn't help me find a hotel after a missed connection. It was pretty bad, but I just needed a place to sleep for 5 hours. They do have a 24 hour shuttle but the guy seemed odd and didn't want to admit he was the driver in the morning and had to be prodded by the front desk woman. One of the soaps in my room was already unwrapped. Talk about budget. But not cheap! $125 for the night. Yikes.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Derfman60
Reviews.Content: Dirty, noisy, inconsiderate hotel staff, what breakfast?

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible. Rooms and hallway dirty. NO breakfast as advertised! Said person didn't show up! Very indifferent desk clerk! Driver drove like a maniac. Ran through 2 stop signs. No working seatbelts in van.
